alerts.RouteAlertText: WSF Alternate Schedule Update for Wednesday, March 2. See bulletin for details: https://wsdot.com/ferries/schedule/bulletin.aspx
alerts.BulletinText:
Washington State Ferries is operating on alternate schedules on most routes until further notice. These changes will help offer more predictable and reliable service systemwide in the face of crewing shortages due to a global shortage of mariners that has been worsened by the pandemic. WSF will attempt to add service when possible, and will provide notifications when full service can temporarily be restored to a route.

For Wednesday, March 2, the following routes are operating on alternate schedules:

  • Seattle/Bremerton Alternate Service
  • 2-Boat Fauntleroy/Vashon, 2-Boat Fauntleroy / Southworth, 2-boat Southworth/Vashon

The following routes are running the regular winter schedules:

  • Anacortes/San Juan Islands: Reservations available
  • Port Townsend/Coupeville: Reservations available
  • Edmonds/Kingston
  • Mukilteo / Clinton
  • Seattle/Bainbridge Island
  • Point Defiance/Tahlequah

The schedule page online shows the currently active schedules in the top section, and the inactive schedules are below.  Please note that the active schedules may change daily depending on crew availability, so please be sure to monitor email alerts and check the Travel Alert Bulletins page for updates.

alerts.RouteAlertText: Correction - Sea/BI-Free COVID Testing on Seattle/Bainbridge Route Today, March 2. See updated Bulletin for details.
alerts.BulletinText: Correction: Customers sailing aboard the #1 Wenatchee on the Seattle/Bainbridge route will be able to get free COVID-19 testing today, March 2.  Altius Institute for Biomedical Sciences will be providing the tests to all interested customers between 7:05 a.m. and 5:15 p.m. Customers can visit Altius’ website to sign-up in advance and get more information about testing.

alerts.RouteAlertText: Sea/BI/Brem - New ORCA Card Testing at Seattle Terminal Feb. 14 - May 14
alerts.BulletinText:
Beginning Monday, February 14 through May 14, WSF will be testing New ORCA system card readers at one turnstile and one passenger tollbooth at Colman Dock in Seattle. During this period, the turnstile will be closed. The passenger tollbooth will remain open but will not be able to complete ORCA transactions. Signs will be posted to inform customers which tollbooth cannot be used for ORCA payment.

Visit www.myorca.com to learn about exciting new updates to ORCA.

alerts.RouteAlertText: Edm/King - ADA - Passenger Elevator on Spokane Out of Service
alerts.BulletinText: The passenger elevator on the M/V Spokane is temporarily out of service for maintenance and repairs. Passengers may contact the crew to use the freight elevator. Updates on a repair status will be provided when more information becomes available. We apologize for the inconvenience.

alerts.RouteAlertText: Sea/BI - Comments Accepted on B.I. Overhead Loading Walkway Project by March 3
alerts.BulletinText: Customers have a little more than a week left to comment on Washington State Ferries' online open house for the Bainbridge Overhead Loading Walkway project. The comment period closes on Thursday, March 3. Anyone interested in the project can visit the site to learn more about the work, construction impacts, and share ideas about how we can best engage terminal neighbors, regular commuters, and the North Kitsap community

alerts.RouteAlertText: Masks Required Only in Indoor Areas of Terminals and Vessels
alerts.BulletinText: Face masks are now required only in indoor areas of our terminals and vessels for all riders and employees in compliance with the latest CDC guidelines. All customers inside terminals or vessels should continue to wear face coverings. However, passengers can remove their masks while outdoors on the sun deck, car deck areas of the vessel, outside waiting areas at terminals and other outdoor locations. Please remember to mask up upon reentering interior areas of boats and terminals.

alerts.RouteAlertText: Edm/King - Edmonds Terminal Holding Lane Partial Closures Began October 11
alerts.BulletinText: Beginning on Monday, Oct. 11, a contractor for the City of Edmonds has been using one of the terminal holding lanes on State Route 104/Edmonds Way from 6 a.m. Mondays through 4:30 p.m. Thursdays for several months. Both approach lanes will be open for ferry travelers Thursday evenings through Sunday and holidays. We appreciate your support while the City of Edmonds conducts important sewer work. We will keep you informed as this continues.
